page.title: 10An Ordinary Day
page.content: My day begins abruptly around 6:30 am when the younger of my three sons, Gregory,who is five years old, starts his day by diving onto the largest lump visible beneath our duvet (fortunately for me it usually belongs to my husband,Dennis).The one advantage of riotous behaviour is that Dennis will normally decide that he prepers the safer confines of the kitchen and will go downstairs to make an early morning cuppa.I only drink coffee instant decaffeinated with skimmed milk and artificial sweetners (more designed to watch my figure than worry about cholestoral. Dennis prefers tea- the one tea bag in a cup,pour on water and give it a good stir variety(whatever happened to warming the pot and leaving tea to
